intro: Triaspis mooreana, commonly known as the Moore's triaspis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant has a woody stem and produces elliptical, leathery leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
